snippet: Cleveland wonders whether it should fight to maintain the modicum of integration it has achieved, or accept the federal government’s more vigorous efforts to desegregate.
abstract: Cleveland, Miss, High School Board must decide whether to appeal federal court ruling that school district, which is about 45 percent black and 47 percent white, must desegregate and consolidate with virtually all-black East Side High; many African-Americans are optimistic that ruling will erase what is left of old racial divisions, while many whites fear it will prompt white families to send their children to private schools or even leave city altogether.
lead_paragraph: Cleveland wonders whether it should fight to maintain the modicum of integration it has achieved, or accept the federal government’s more vigorous efforts to desegregate.

headline.main: In Mississippi Town, Some Fear School Desegregation Ruling May Backfire
headline.print_headline: Mississippi Town Is Relic of Segregated School Era
